oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Photograph of a French 75 mm gun with limber
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Shown in the photograph is a French 75 mm artillery piece. Commonly refered to simply as a "French 75," this cannon was the workhorse of both the French and American artillery units in WWI. This example is shown attached to its limber while other limbers and caissons are visible to the side. The Still Image belonged to Sgt. Ernest West, Batry. B, 114th F.A. Regt., 30th Div. West was from the Chattanooga area as was most of Batry. B.
